The use of reverse image search: The expert employed reverse image search to verify the authenticity of the claim. They found that several of the images being circulated were actually from past incidents such as the 2005 Kashmir earthquake and a suicide bomb attack in 2014.
Comparison with credible sources: The expert compared the viral images with photographs from credible sources such as Getty Images, CNN, Dawn, and Al Jazeera. By finding the original photographs on these reputable platforms, they were able to confirm that the viral images were not depicting the recent turmoil between India and Pakistan.
Analysis of image captions and accompany: The expert paid attention to the captions and accompanying text shared with the viral images. They noted that the captions used phrases like "पुलवामा की तो तस्वीर बहुत देखी जरा आज पाकिस्तान का भी हाल देखो!!!!" which indicated a biased narrative and suggested that the images were being misrepresented.
Tracing the origin and context of the im: The expert traced the origin and context of the images by investigating their publication dates and descriptions. They found that some images were from incidents unrelated to the recent altercation between India and Pakistan, such as a terrorist attack in Punjab in 2015 and a military operation in Pakistan's Hangu in 2014. This helped establish that the images were not representative of the current situation.
